page.title: 11Gospel Hall/Calfaria Chapel
page.content: The Gospel Hall congregation originated in 1919 when a group of 12 members erected a tent for worship. The Evangelists at this time were a Mr. Benard and a Mr. McCoulough. Later in 1919 the members erected an army hut for their meetings. In 1926 local land owner Mrs. Blandy Jenkins provided a plot near the Llanharan Colliery to build the permanent hall which was to hold 150 people. The hall was opened in 1927. Today there is still an active congregation at the Gospel. Calfaria chapel had its beginnings during the 1926 General Strike when a stage was erected to provide entertainment for striking miners. It was also used by Welsh Baptists. The chapel was built in January 1929 and forced to close in 1968, due to a lack of Welsh-speaking attenders.
